instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi everyone.

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that does not detect an accessory such as usb c to hdmi through the J3300 port, normal charging in both ports on both sides.

In the JB500 connector it works perfectly.

I already changed <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Do you get 5V at L3500, when connect an USB device to J3300?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
solved... problems in that sector corrosion and broken tracks...

thanks for guiding me [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]
